javazaawansowana.lab1

Class KnapsackProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • javazaawansowana.lab1.KnapsackProblem

  • public class KnapsackProblem
extends java.lang.Object
    Class designed to solve Knapsack Problem. It contains only one method (except of constructor) that lets you choose one of three algorithms to solve instance of Knapsack Problem you put into the class.
    Author:
    Kamil Kluba 226016
    See Also:
    Knapsack, Item, GreedyAlgorithm, RandomAlgorithm, BruteForceAlgorithm

      KnapsackProblem(int capacity, java.util.ArrayList<Item> listOfItems)

    • Constructor Detail

      • KnapsackProblem

        public KnapsackProblem(int capacity,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Item> listOfItems)
        Constructor contains two parameters that are necessary to solve an instance of Knapsack Problem.
        Parameters:
        capacity - Capacity of knapsack.
        listOfItems - List of items that may be packed into knapsack.

    • Method Detail

      • chooseAlgorithmToRun

        public void chooseAlgorithmToRun(java.lang.String algorithm,
                                 int repetitions)
        This method lets you choose algorithm you want to use for your instance of Knapsack Problem.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Chooses an algorithm to use. There are three possible options of using it: 1 - chooses greedy algorithm 2 - chooses random algorithm any Integer else - chooses brute force algorithm.
        repetitions - This parameter only matters when you use random algorithm. It describes number of repetitions that algorithm makes to find the best solutions. In two other cases this parameter does nothing.

      • getListOfAlgorithms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getListOfAlgorithms()
        This method returns list of implemented algorithms that solves Knapsack problem
        Returns:
        list of possible algorithms

      • getResult

        public java.lang.String getResult()
        This method returns String that contains solution
        Returns:
        solution of the Knapsack problem

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
